meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel more confident or courageous.
meanings.sent1: Seeing his friends cheer him on was emboldening for the shy boy.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk was emboldening for the team before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows were surprisingly emboldening as it faced the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun cast an emboldening light on the mountain climbers, urging them to reach the summit.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouraging words were like a warm embrace, emboldening her students to speak up.

meanings.definition: To give (someone) the courage or confidence to do something.
meanings.sent1: The supportive crowd's cheers were emboldening the singer to perform her best.
meanings.sent2: The success of her first project emboldened her to take on more challenging tasks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was emboldening the birds to join in its acorn-stealing antics.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music was emboldening the dancers to move with grace and confidence.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the top of the mountain was truly emboldening, filling them with a sense of accomplishment.
